alert.note: Alert for Allen; Avoyelles; Beauregard; East Cameron; Evangeline; Northern Acadia; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Rapides; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry; Vernon; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 17 at 2:32AM CDT until September 17 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning Posted for Portions of SE Texas and SW Louisiana... .Relative humidity values are expected to drop below 30 percent this afternoon. Meanwhile, fuels in this area are extremely dry due to the exceptional drought that is ongoing. As sustained north winds increase in the 6 to 12 mph range this afternoon, these conditions will be ideal for a rapid spread of wildland fires. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS AND SOUTHWEST LOUISIANA... The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a Red Flag Warning for portions of southeast Texas and southwest Louisiana, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 8 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Vernon, Rapides, Avoyelles, Beauregard, Allen, Evangeline, St. Landry, West Cameron, East Cameron, Northern Calcasieu, Northern Jefferson Davis, Northern Acadia, Southern Calcasieu, Southern Jefferson Davis, Southern Acadia, Northern Jasper, Northern Newton, Southern Jasper, Southern Newton, Northern Orange and Southern Orange. * TIMING...from late this morning and into the early evening hours. * WINDS...North 5 to 12 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...minimum relative humidity is expected to range from 20 to 30 percent during the afternoon hours. * TEMPERATURES...In the low to mid 90s. * IMPACTS...these conditions will be ideal for a rapid spread of wildland fires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Avoyelles; Beauregard; East Cameron; Evangeline; Northern Acadia; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Rapides; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry; Vernon; West Cameron
